body:
Are you doing username / password authentication?

The normal `vendor = sharepoint` uses a magic cookie... which is the https transaction you see.

Try with `vendor = other` and see if that helps.

Switching to "vendor = other" does allow the connection via HTTP to complete, thank you.  However, any subsequent task results in a continuous stream of '401 Unauthorized' errors, which is weird since I'm using a domain admin account.  Rather than worry any further about what will soon be a historical footnote, I'll use PowerShell from a Windows 10 unit for this effort instead.

P.S. â€” To counter a future [search fiasco](https://xkcd.com/979/), this [blog post from 2017](https://christopherclementen.wordpress.com/2017/08/14/download-all-files-from-library/) contains a script that is working to recursively pull all files from this legacy SharePoint server (after executing 'Install-Module SharePointPnPPowerShell2016' of course).

Hey @optimiz @ncw, all,
I know this ticket is closed, so I'm happy to make a new one if you'd like.

I'm experiencing the same issues as @optimiz currently. I'm trying to connect to an on-premise Sharepoint 2013 server over port 80 using Rclone's webdav connector.

Any tips on connecting Rclone to a "http://" Sharepoint 2013 instance via the webdav connector?

Also, something else interesting to note, I tried mapping the Sharepoint 2013 site as a named mapped drive in Windows 10 (X:/) and using Rclone to read from my local machine, but it's not able to read the contents of the mapped drive (although I can run a "dir" command and see the contents outside of Rclone).

Appreciate the help!

Actually I looked at the code for the cookie magic and it has `https` hard wired in.

I changed it to use the `http` or `https` as configured so hopefully that will work.

Can you give this a go?

[v1.55.0-beta.5340.470d1c197.fix-4418-webdav-sharepoint-http](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-4418-webdav-sharepoint-http/v1.55.0-beta.5340.470d1c197.fix-4418-webdav-sharepoint-http/) on branch [fix-4418-webdav-sharepoint-http](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-4418-webdav-sharepoint-http) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
@ncw This worked great! I'm able to connect and list on-premise SP2013 files using the new sharepoint-ntlm vendor option. Thank you so much! :)

Just one thing to note: I'm able to use the new Rclone connector to connect to an SP2013 using http://.

However, I still wasn't able to read from a windows mapped drive that pointed to the same webdav connection (for example: X: drive mapped to the same site). 

It's probably just Windows being unique in how they map Sharepoint's HTTP:// Webdav connection. Wanted to just let you know about that, Nick. Let me know if you need any additional info from me. I know it's a rather edge-case scenario.

Thanks!

Thank you for resolving this issue in **rclone**.  Alternatively, last month I had one last big migration push and used the official [Microsoft SharePoint Migration Tool ](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sharepointmigration/how-to-use-the-sharepoint-migration-tool), which is finally (circa its October 2020 update) able to perform these functions directly from even as old as SharePoint 2010.  It took three continuous days to complete every last transfer, but it's done and those legacy servers have been fully decommissioned. ðŸ˜…

P.S. - Can the tags on this issue be updated to "bug" or "enhancement" rather than "question"?

@optimiz 
Please confirm that below rclone beta works for you
https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-4418-webdav-sharepoint-http/v1.55.0-beta.5340.470d1c197.fix-4418-webdav-sharepoint-http/
If yes, Nick will promote this beta to rclone master for the next release

@jonathanpantall

> I wasn't able to read from a windows mapped drive that pointed to the same webdav connection (for example: X: drive mapped to the same site).

If `rclone.exe copy X:\something .\` fails, that's most probably a permissions issue unrelated to this ticket. For rclone, mapped drives are just yet another local path.
Try something _native_ from the same console window, for example `copy X:\something .\`, I think it will fail too. If it won't, open a _new_ support request on https://forum.rclone.org or here.
